description:
The story follows the everyday life of Itsuki, a novelist and "modern day Pygmalion" who works day in and day out to create the ultimate younger sister. He's surrounded by various other characters: a beautiful genius writer who loves him, his big-sisterly classmate from college, a fellow male writer, a sadistic tax accountant, and his editor. They're all looked after by Itsuki's perfect younger step-brother, Chihiro, who has a serious secret.

(Source: Anime News Network)

Note: The first episode received an early screening at a special event held at Shinjuku Piccadilly, Tokyo on 06.09.2017.
synonyms: It'd be Good if Only Little Sister Was Here
คงจะดี ถ้ามีน้องสาวสักคน

tags.name: Writing
tags.description: Centers around the profession of writing books or novels.

tags.name: Otaku Culture
tags.description: Centers around the culture of a fanatical fan-base.

tags.name: Work
tags.description: Centers around the activities of a certain occupation.

tags.name: Ensemble Cast
tags.description: Features a large cast of characters with (almost) equal screen time and importance to the plot.

tags.name: Nudity
tags.description: Features a character wearing no clothing or exposing intimate body parts.

tags.name: Coming of Age
tags.description: Centers around a character's transition from childhood to adulthood.

tags.name: Heterosexual
tags.description: Prominently features a romance between a man and a woman, not inherently sexual.

tags.name: Board Game
tags.description: Centers around characters playing board games.

tags.name: Love Triangle
tags.description: Centered around romantic feelings between more than two people. Includes all love polygons.

tags.name: Crossdressing
tags.description: Prominently features a character dressing up as the opposite sex.

tags.name: Video Games
tags.description: Centers around characters playing video games.

tags.name: College
tags.description: Partly or completely set in a college or university.

tags.name: Gender Bending
tags.description: Prominently features a character who dresses and behaves in a way characteristic of another gender, or has been transformed into a person of another gender.

node.description:
[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hirasakayomi)

Yomi Hirasaka begin their debut as novelist in 2004 from the Light Novel series "Haunted!" that won MF Bunko 0th J-Light Novel Newcomer Award (Japanese: 第0回MF文庫Jライトノベル新人賞). The pen name Yomi Hirasaka used derived from the Japanese mythological slope in the realm of underworld called "Yomotsu-Hirasaka" (黄泉平坂).

__Currently living:__ Saitama Prefecture, Japan

Kantoku is an illustrator, artist, and key illustrator born March 26, 1985. He established, and is currently active in his own circle, 5nen me no Houkago (5年目の放課後, lit. 5th Year's After School). 

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/kantoku_5th) | [Pixiv](https://www.pixiv.net/en/users/1565632) | [Circle](http://5-y.2-d.jp/)

[Wiki (jp)](https://ja.wikipedia.org/wiki/大沼心) | [Wiki (en)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Shin_Oonuma)

After graduating from Chiyoda Institute of Technology he joined Office AO where he worked as an animator. He later joined Shaft in 2004 as a subcontractor, and he became [Akiyuki Shinbou's](https://anilist.co/staff/100089/) right hand until 2009. When he stopped working for Shaft, he found his new home at studio Silver Link, where he is to-date known as their most prominent director. Noted for directing shows such as [ef: A Tale of Melodies](https://anilist.co/anime/4789/), [Baka to Test](https://anilist.co/anime/6347/) and [Kokoro Connect](https://anilist.co/anime/11887/).

Oonuma is known to like so called moe games.

__[Website](http://kikuyatomoki.com/)__

__Birthplace:__ Mitaka, Tokyo, Japan

__Introduction:__
Tomoki Kikuya is a Japanese composer and arranger, who works for music studio Popholic. His brother Kikuya Hiroki (菊谷宏樹), is the director of TVK's saku saku music show.

__Biography:__
Kikuya started a career as guitarist in the music band Mustang A.K.A under Sony Records. Later he was part of Funanori. Starting from 2005 Kikuya decided to focus on working as a music composer and arranger. He has arranged and composed several songs featured in anime since then, starting with theme songs for Pani Poni Dash.

__[Official Website](http://choucho-net.com/)__ | __[Blog (JP)](http://ameblo.jp/choucho621/)__ | __[Twitter](https://twitter.com/choucho_)__ | __[NicoNico](https://www.nicovideo.jp/user/3416529) | [Instragram](https://www.instagram.com/choucho621/)__ | __[YouTube](https://www.youtube.com/channel/UCGK8Fhw3qDEtHaivTsxfGgg)__ | __[Spotify](https://open.spotify.com/artist/5t7eQ2d1UmzfIr9oWQ538Y?autoplay=true)__

__Introduction:__
ChouCho is a Japanese singer-utaite known for doing vocal covers of Vocaloid songs on NicoNico Douga, in addition to making frequent appearances in anime with original songs.

__Biography:__
In 2007, she initially formed the band Lotus*Lotus (stylized as ロータス★ロータス) while still in high school, the band performed covers of songs from anime, then starting from June 2008 she first appeared on NicoNico with her cover of the song "[Black★Rock Shooter](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm3706654)" under stage name ちょうちょ. In 2011, she made her first major debut under record label Lantis, singing the opening theme song to the anime [Kamisama no Memochou](https://anilist.co/anime/10568/Kamisama-no-Memochou/), titled "[Kawaru Mirai](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Un9UiVL6Dms)", and later in the same year she reappeared with the opening theme song to the anime [Mashiroiro Symphony](https://anilist.co/anime/10397/Mashiroiro-Symphony-The-Color-of-Lovers), titled "[Authentic Symphony](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=QzGWaS0lyIo)", then in 2012, after releasing her 4th single titled "[Yasashisa no Riyuu](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=0hJiMN4Csjw)", she changed her stage name from ちょうちょ to ChouCho. The song was also used as the 1st opening theme song to the anime [Hyouka](https://anilist.co/anime/12189/Hyouka/), which released in 2012.

Her last upload to NicoNico was an album released with Comiket 81, titled "[Little Nostalgia](https://www.nicovideo.jp/watch/sm16484379)", featuring 5 songs: Breeze, Beautiful World (Acoustic Ver.), Hana to Hoshi no Monogatari, North York and Under the Maple Tree.

__Real name:__ Asuka Kato (加藤あすか)

[Website](http://www.spacecraft.co.jp/yuuki_aira/)

A J pop singer attached to the company Lantis. She began her career in 2007 performing in [Yuki Kajura](https://anilist.co/staff/100077)'s [FictionJunction](https://anilist.co/staff/103691) as "FictionJunction ASUKA". She released her debut album- Reflection on July 2, 2008.

Non-anime roles:
Hom-kun in "Atelier Meruru" (VG) (Japanese)
Theme Song Performance (OP/ED) for "Root Double -Before Crime * After Days-" (Visual novel) (Japanese)

[Twitter](https://twitter.com/hirasakayomi)

Yomi Hirasaka begin their debut as novelist in 2004 from the Light Novel series "Haunted!" that won MF Bunko 0th J-Light Novel Newcomer Award (Japanese: 第0回MF文庫Jライトノベル新人賞). The pen name Yomi Hirasaka used derived from the Japanese mythological slope in the realm of underworld called "Yomotsu-Hirasaka" (黄泉平坂).

__[Website](https://yuxukiwaga.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuxuki)__

__Birthplace:__ Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan

__Yuuki Waga__, alternatively known as yuxuki waga, is a Japanese sound producer, guitarist and member of the pop band fhána.

__[Website](https://yuxukiwaga.com/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/yuxuki)__

__Birthplace:__ Hokkaido Prefecture, Japan

__Yuuki Waga__, alternatively known as yuxuki waga, is a Japanese sound producer, guitarist and member of the pop band fhána.

__Height:__ 162 cm (5'4")

[Profile](http://www.artsvision.co.jp/talent/715/) | [Twitter](https://twitter.com/numakura_manami) | [Instagram](https://www.instagram.com/nu_manami/) | [Blog](http://blog.livedoor.jp/mnm_n_/) 

A voice actor affiliated with Arts Vision. She is married to fellow seiyuu [Ryouta Oosaka](https://anilist.co/staff/110743) as of October 23, 2019.

[Profile](http://www.kenproduction.co.jp/talent/member.php?mem=w88)

__Non-anime roles:__
Bataan in "Azur Lane"
Bush in "Aur Lane" (VG)
Hazelwood in "Azur Lane" (VG)
Kiyoka Musumi in "Toji no Miko" (VG) (Japanese)
Shangri-la in "Azur Lane" (VG)
Sucrose in "Genshin Impact"
